warningLeaveDialog.title: Warning
warningLeaveDialog.instructions: Are you sure that you want to leave the edition questionnaire screen without exporting first?

languages.confirmDeletion: Do you wish to delete the questionnaire with language '{language}', losing all progress?

import.instructions: Please upload a Questionnaire JSON file that you would like to edit. Drag & drop the file on this area or click here to select a file.

editor.questionDontexist: Question does not exist in this Questionnaire.
editor.toSelectOneAnswer: Double tap to select one answer option.
editor.deleteItemDialogue: Do you really want to delete this item, all of its child items and all relevant enableWhen?
editor.question: Question

messagesErrors.fileNoExported: JSON File could no be exported. File was downloaded in Donwloads instead.

FHIRValidations.languageMissing: FHIR Resource Content Invalid! Missing language of Questionnaire.
FHIRValidations.unsupportedLanguage: FHIR Resource Content Invalid! Unsupported language {language} in Questionnaire.
FHIRValidations.nodeMissing: FHIR Resource Content Invalid! Missing Information on {node}. {item}
FHIRValidations.nodeMissingItem: FHIR Resource Content Invalid! {node} in Item {linkId}.
FHIRValidations.typeNodeNoValAllow: Item {linkId} {type} type value is not allowed.
FHIRValidations.answerOptionAndValueSetNoAllow: Item {linkId} has [answerOption] and [answerValueSet], both are not allowed.
FHIRValidations.linkId: Item: [{linkId} - {text}] has an error, it doesn't follow the right sequence of LinkId. Link ID should be {internalId} instead if {linkId}.

GeneralJSONValidations.fileNoJSONType: File {nameFile} imported is no a JSON File. Only JSON Files are allowed.
GeneralJSONValidations.jsonFileIsNotString: JSON-File is not of type string
GeneralJSONValidations.NoJSONFILEStructure: Content of file loaded has no a properly structure of a JSON.

tutorial.answerChoice: Questions allowing pre-defined answers via AnswerOption and AnswerValueSet for single- and multiple-choice functionality.
tutorial.type: Type represents a display, grouping of questions or a question. The type of a question dictates what data is captured as answers to this question from the end-user.
tutorial.linkId: LinkId uniquely identifies the question in the questionnaire and is used to link collected answers to the corresponding question.
tutorial.text: Question text displayed to the end-user.
tutorial.prefix: Prefix for the question text, e.g. 1.a).
tutorial.required: Required items have to be answered by the end-user for a questionnaire to be considered completed.
tutorial.repeats: Repeating items allow multiple answers from the end-user to this question. This has to be true to allow multiple Initial-values or multiple AnswerOption with InitialSelected set to true.
tutorial.readOnly: ReadOnly items do not allow the end-user to change answers to this question. If the item is a group, all of its children are read-only.
tutorial.definition: Definition is a URI to another FHIR Resource containing additional information about this item. For more information check the documentation.
tutorial.maxLength: The maximum amount of characters allowed for answers to this question.
tutorial.answerChoiceToggle: AnswerOption and AnswerValueSet contain pre-defined answers, used for single- and multiple-choice questions, to this question. AnswerOption allows custom pre-defined answers, while AnswerValueSet links to a set of pre-defined values.
tutorial.answerConstraint: AnswerConstraint defines whether additional answers to the pre-defined answers in AnswerOption or AnswerValueSet are allowed. "optionsOnly" signals no additional answers are allowed. "optionsOrType" or "optionsOrString" allow an answer of the same type of the question or a free-text answer respectively.
tutorial.answerValueSet: AnswerValueSet is a canonical URI linking to a set of pre-defined values allowed as answers to this question. Repeating items with defined AnswerValueSet are multiple-choice, otherwise they are single-choice.
tutorial.answerOption:
AnswerOptions contain custom pre-defined answers for this question.
They match the type of this question. Repeating items with defined AnswerOptions are multiple-choice, otherwise they are single-choice. InitialSelected indicates which option is selected by default.
tutorial.enableWhen: EnableWhen contains conditions, based on answers to other questions, that have to be met for this question to be enabled for the end-user.
tutorial.enableBehavior: EnableBehavior indicates whether all or any conditions of EnableWhen have to be met for this question to be enabled.
tutorial.disabledDisplay: DisabledDisplay indicates whether this question is hidden or not interactable (protected) for the end-user if it is disabled.
tutorial.extension: Extensions add additional functionality to the questionnaire, depending on the type of the item. Fore more information check the documentation.
tutorial.initial: Initial values are pre-populated answers to this question for the end-user. Multiple initial values are only permitted for repeating questions.
tutorial.code: Codes represent concepts from the LOINC codesystem this item corresponds to. Fore more information check the documentation.
tutorial.url: URL is a globally unique canonical URI referencing this questionnaires. This allows linking to this questionnaire with e.g. "derivedFrom".
tutorial.versionAlgorithmString: This is a FHIRPath expression comparing two versions.
tutorial.name: Name is a machine-friendly, natural language name identifying the questionnaire for application processing.
tutorial.title: Title is a human-friendly, natural language name for the questionnaire for the end-user.
tutorial.date: Date is the latest date, and optionally time, when the questionnaire substantially changed.
tutorial.effectivePeriod: EffectivePeriod is the period in which the questionnaire is expected to be used.
tutorial.Text: Text is a human-readable Narrative containing a summary of the questionnaire, that can be used to represent the questionnaire to the end-user.
tutorial.identifier: Identifier contains business identifiers used outside of FHIR.

Extension.hidden: Hidden can only be changed using the toggle in the item-tree.
